solution.text:
Cost of one chocolate =Total cost \(\div\) Number of Chocolates
Cost of one chocolate = Rs. \(\frac {_{{j*5}}_}{_{{10*k}}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Hence, Price of a single chocolate= Rs. _{{j/Decimal(2*k)}}_

content.text: Given the total price of buying chocolates is _{{j*5}}_ Rs and the number of chocolates bought is _{{10*k}}_. What should be the Price of a single chocolate?
